00001 //
00002 //  Catcher.m - print stack trace of exceptions and break to debugger
00003 //  ObjCpp
00004 //
00005 //  Created by John Holdsworth on 27/11/2008.
00006 //  Copyright 2008 __MyCompanyName__. All rights reserved.
00007 //
00008 //  $Id: //depot/ObjCpp/Catcher.m#7 $
00009 //  $DateTime: 2009/10/08 10:10:49 $
00010 //
00011 
00012 #ifdef OODEBUG
00013 #import <Foundation/Foundation.h>
00014 
00015 @interface NSException(Catcher)
00016 @end
00017 
00018 @implementation NSException(Catcher)
00019 
00020 // only for use in applications which do not use exceptions routinely themselves...
00021 - (id)initWithName:(NSString *)theName reason:(NSString *)theReason userInfo:(NSDictionary *)userInfo {
00022     
00023     @try {
00024         @throw self;
00025     }
00026     @catch ( NSException *ex ) {
00027         NSMutableString *buffer = [NSMutableString string];
00028         [buffer appendFormat:@"atos -p %d -printHeader", getpid()];
00029         
00030         for( NSNumber *n in [ex callStackReturnAddresses] )
00031             [buffer appendFormat:@" %u", [n intValue]];
00032         
00033         NSLog( @"executing:\n\n%@\n\n", buffer );
00034         system( [buffer UTF8String] );
00035     }
00036 
00037     NSLog( @"*** Terminating app due to uncaught exception '%@', reason: '%@'", theName, theReason );
00038 
00039     (*(int *)0)++; // invalid memory access hands control over to debugger...
00040     return self;
00041 }
00042 
00043 @end
00044 #endif
